org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsFileFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileFactory

  • public final class PwsFileFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a singleton factory class with static methods used to load and save PasswordSafe files of all known formats. It is capable of detecting file format versions and handling differences appropriately. All three major file formats (referred to as V1, V2 and V3) can be read and written. The user is confronted with unified methods and addresses version differences through file version numbers. As the older versions 1 and 2 are practically out of use, the typical usage is by stating the default version number 0 or the default methods without version reference.

    The file format undergoes minor enhancements over time, which consist mostly in added data fields and are reflected by the "minor" file format number. Backward compatibility is always sought. The PWS database format additionally seeks forward compatibility by asking applications to conserve unknown data in the files. This PWS library fully conforms with this requirement.

    The field type constants provided with this class refer to RECORD FIELDS and are given public for the convenience of applications which attempt to interpret the block data stream of a PWS file in their own fashions. Alternatively to this factory, a PWS file can be interpreted as a stream of data blocks or a stream of data fields by use of PwsFileInputSocket and the PwsRawFieldReader interface for reading and PwsFileOutputSocket and the PwsRawFieldWriter interface for writing. The documents describing the various file formats are supplied in the "doc" section of the developer package of this library.

    Header Fields as Save Parameter

    The save methods feature a parameter headerFields to allow application specific supply of file header data in the context of V3 databases. User header fields are only made persistent in format V3; the official canon of header fields is listed as constants in class PwsFileHeaderV3. For a target file of format version V2 only field type PwsFileHeaderV3.JPWS_OPTIONS_TYPE is extracted from the header field list. JPasswords stores file specific properties there. A target file V1 does not interpret the header fields.

    The file and record format of this factory complies with PWS format definition 3.13.

    See Also:
    HeaderFieldList, ApplicationAdapter, PwsPassphrase

    • Method Detail

      • loadFile

        public static final PwsFile loadFile(java.lang.String filepath,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     PasswordSafeException
        Loads a PWS file of any format from the standard application adapter (by default the local file system).
        Parameters:
        filepath - the pathname of the file to open
        passphrase - the file access passphrase
        Returns:
        the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
        InvalidPassphraseException - if file access could not be verified
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
        PasswordSafeException

      • loadFile

        public static final PwsFile loadFile(ContextFile file,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                     int format)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     PasswordSafeException
        Loads a PWS file of a specific format from a file specified by a ContextFile parameter. (If a format other than 0 is specified, loading will fail if the referred persistent state is of a different format.)
        Parameters:
        file - ContextFile the file in an application context
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase the user passphrase
        format - int the file format version (values of Global), 0 for a generic open request (any version)
        Returns:
        the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any filepath is empty
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
        InvalidPassphraseException
        WrongFileVersionException - if a specific format was requested and not found to match that of the file
        UnsupportedFileVersionException - if the requested format is unknown
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
        PasswordSafeException

        PwsFile open, fully operable PWS file

        InvalidPassphraseException

        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred

        protected static final PwsFile loadFile(ApplicationAdapter application,
                                        java.lang.String filepath,
                                        PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                        int format)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        PasswordSafeException
        Loads a PWS file of a specific format from a user application context. (If a format other than 0 is specified, loading will fail if the referred pesistent state is of a different format.)
        Parameters:
        application - ApplicationAdapter the IO-context of the file
        filepath - String the pathname of the file to open
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase the user passphrase
        format - int the file format version (values of Global), 0 for a generic open request (any version)
        Returns:
        PwsFile open, fully operable PWS file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
        InvalidPassphraseException
        WrongFileVersionException - if a specific format was requested and not found to match the file
        UnsupportedFileVersionException - if the requested format is unknown
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
        PasswordSafeException

      • loadFile

        public static final PwsFile loadFile(java.io.InputStream in,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                     int format)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     PasswordSafeException
        Loads a PWS file of a specific format from a user input stream. Note that persistent state definition is void in returned object. (If a format other than 0 is specified, loading will fail if the persistent state is of a different format.)
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream containing persistent state of the file
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase the user passphrase
        format - int the file format version (values of Global), 0 for a generic open request (any version)
        Returns:
        PwsFile open, fully operable PWS file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
        InvalidPassphraseException
        WrongFileVersionException - if a specific format was requested and not found to match the file
        UnsupportedFileVersionException - if the requested format is unknown
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
        PasswordSafeException

      • makeFile

        public static UUID makeFile(ContextFile file,
                            PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                            int iterations)
                     throws ApplicationFailureException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Creates an empty PWS file of the latest format at the destination given by the context file. The proper PwsPassphrase to decrypt the file has to be specified.

        Security: If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath. Upon regular termination the temp-file is removed. It remains existent if the regular named file cannot be realised.

        Parameters:
        file - ContextFile the target file
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase the user's file access key
        iterations - int number of security key calculation loops (this is meant to slow guessing attacks); a minimum is assumed
        Returns:
        UUID file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameter is not defined
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an output stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • saveFile

        public static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> records,
                                  java.lang.String filepath,
                                  PwsPassphrase pass,
                                  HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                  int iterations,
                                  int format)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  ApplicationFailureException
        Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator whose elements are of type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is determined by a filepath in the context of the standard application (by default the local file system). The user's file access key is passed in through a PwsPassphrase.

        If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. (This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath. Upon regular termination the temp-file is removed. It remains existent if the regular named file cannot be realised.)

        Parameters:
        records - Iterator<PwsRecord> or null for empty database
        filepath - String target file path valid in the standard IO-context (by default the local file system)
        pass - PwsPassphrase file access passphrase
        headerFields - HeaderFieldList field list to be included as header in the file or null
        iterations - int number of security key calculation loops
        format - int file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
        Returns:
        UUID file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any essential parameter is not defined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
        ApplicationFailureException - if the IO-context does not render an output stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • saveFile

        protected static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> records,
                                     ApplicationAdapter app,
                                     java.lang.String filepath,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                     HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                     int iterations,
                                     int format)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     ApplicationFailureException
        Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator whose elements are of type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is determined by ApplicationAdapter and a filepath.

        If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. (This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath. Upon regular termination the temp-file is removed. It remains existent if the regular named file cannot be realised.)

        Parameters:
        records - Iterator<PwsRecord> or null for empty database
        app - ApplicationAdapter IO-context
        filepath - String the target file path valid in IO-context
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase user's file access key
        headerFields - HeaderFieldList header field list to be included in the file or null
        iterations - int number of security key calculation loops
        format - int file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
        Returns:
        UUID file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any essential parameter is not defined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an output stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • saveFile

        public static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> records,
                                  ContextFile file,
                                  PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                  HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                  int iterations,
                                  int format)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  ApplicationFailureException
        Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator of element type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is determined by a ContextFile parameter. The user's file access key is given by a PwsPassphrase.

        If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. (This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath. Upon regular termination the temp-file is removed. It remains existent if the regular named file cannot be realised.)

        Parameters:
        records - Iterator<PwsRecord> or null for empty database
        file - ContextFile the target file in an IO-context
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase file access key
        headerFields - HeaderFieldList header field list to be included in the file or null
        iterations - int number of security key calculation loops
        format - int file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
        Returns:
        UUID file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any essential parameter is not defined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
        ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an output stream
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • saveFile

        public static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> records,
                                  java.io.OutputStream out,
                                  PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                  HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                  int iterations,
                                  int format)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator of element type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is the parameter output stream, which is not closed upon termination of this operation! The user's file access key is given by a PwsPassphrase.
        Parameters:
        records - Iterator<PwsRecord> or null for empty database
        out - OutputStream target output stream
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase user's file access key
        headerFields - HeaderFieldList header field list to be included in the file or null
        iterations - int number of security key calculation loops
        format - int file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
        Returns:
        UUID file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if out or passphrase is not defined
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • isCanonicalField

        public static boolean isCanonicalField(int type,
                                       int format)
        Whether the parameter field type is a canonical field (conventional meaning) in the context of the given file format.
        Parameters:
        type - int the field type in question
        format - int reference file format or 0 for default
